Authors:
Thilini Chethana Kandawatte, Ying Zhou, Wei ZHANG, Mei Liu,
QiKai Xing, XingHong Li, Kevin D Hyde, Jiye Yan
Title:
Coniella vitis sp. nov., the common white rot pathogen of
grapevine in China
Keywords: GCPSR, Histone, Multi gene phylogeny, Vitis
Abstract:
Grape white rot is an important disease, responsible for
mild to severe grape production losses worldwide. We have surveyed Grape
white rot in five provinces in China and collected 27 isolates from
diseased grape tissues. Multigene phylogenetic analyses (ITS, LSU,
Histone and TEF 1-) and genealogical concordance phylogenetic species
recognition, coupled with morphological observations revealed that
Coniella vitis sp. nov., in addition to Coniella diplodiella, are both
causative agents of grape white rot in China. The current study also
provides an optimized multi-gene backbone for resolving Coniella
species. Kochs postulates were performed on the species on Vitis
vinifera summer black cultivar, in a green house. These results
confirmed the pathogenicity as symptoms were reproduced and significant
variations in the pathogenicity among C. vitis isolates was shown. This
work provides evidence that Coniella vitis is the main causal agent of
grape white rot in China.
